subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Babs has Issues!
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_03050bc2-1f36-4ba2-8198-3b0bf85addd3_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Frank R.,
 
Once again pal, we are on apposing sides.
As far as Babs havin=
g many friends here
 
Welllll???
 
Anyway I want to address the subject of =
removing time from a file.
The way I am understanding what you mean by remo=
ving time is to
cut segments of the recording out of the file.
 
I myself d=
o cut out simple noise or static fragments that are naturally occurring in =
the sweep of the box
for instance the minibox has an inherent hum or thump =
as it's Creator calls it.
 
When I receive a response through the minibox i=
t will go something like this "yes HUM Bruce HUM we HUM are HUM here HUM"
I=
 will definitely remove every HUM from between the words but that does not =
change the message or affect the words that are spoken.
I'm assuming that i=
s what you are talking about when you and babs mention "removing time" 
 
I=
'm just guessing but maybe babs is trying to insinuate that researchers her=
e are altering their files., 
If so maybe she should be looking for that in=
 her own back yard. There must be someone she knows for a fact that is
alte=
ring communications.
 
And mike please lets not turn this into a whole big =
thing!
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: warrior18=
eii@...: Mon, 21 Jan 2008 08:03:09 -0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ba=
bs has Issues!






Very good observation Babs. Let me say that you have m=
any friends and associates here just for the simple fact that you have an i=
nterest in ITC, are a researcher and a complex thinker. I think we have sho=
wn in the past that we can have a disagreement and still remain friends. Yo=
u make a lot of good points in your post and I would like to know who remov=
es time from their recordings. I have never removed time from my recordings=
 and see no reason why anyone else would without saying so in an accompanie=
d post.I have limited experience with the 12-469's as a single piece of equ=
ipment. I have arranged mine per Mike's, "Spiricomp" design. I have 3, 12-4=
69's feeding a four channel mixer, which goes into a laptop running DC6 wit=
h Soundsoap 2. Mine scan equally spaced on the FM band. I have had pretty g=
ood results until recently.At first the messages were pretty clear but I ha=
d a feeling I was getting a different group than I normally have for the la=
st few years. When I would ask about my friends on the other side they woul=
d tell me they will look for them. Well about 2 weeks ago the 12-469 arrang=
ement started generating a lot of interference and feedback. I started hear=
ing radio static voices as I use to get with shortwave. Not voice fragments=
 but voices made of static (metallic and robotic). They were breaking throu=
gh the sweeping. I had a feeling someone else was trying to force their way=
 through. Finally the interference got so bad I was forced to revert back t=
o a simpler method I used before, which is using fan noise. One of the firs=
t messages to come across was from a familiar voice telling me and I quote,=
 "your method sucks". I have not used the 12-469's since because of the cle=
ar messages I have been getting using water and fan noise. That does not me=
an I have given up on the 12-469's but I won't use them again until I am pe=
rsuaded to by my friends on the otherside that they are willing to use and =
adapt to it. To my knowledge only Misty, Laura and myself use water for rec=
ording.Regards,Frank R.
----- Original Message ----From: babiarz3 <babiarz3=
@...>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comSent: Monday, January 21, 2008 9:34:0=
1 AMSubject: [EVP-ITC] Babs has Issues!

Alright, you all know I'm vocal an=
d I haven't made any "friends" herebut, if we can put that aside for a mome=
nt...Spirit communication has been my passion since day one, a little over6=
 years ago. I am a believer in the afterlife and a believer inspirits attem=
pting to communicate with us for a variety of reasons. Ihave spiritual beli=
efs that I feel strongly about and devote much ofmy waking (and sleeping) m=
oments to thoughts about this field.However, I am also a researcher and a s=
keptic. In order for me toallow ideas to become part of my reality I must e=
xperiment. In orderfor me to believe something is paranormal I HAVE to rule=
 out all otherpossible causes. That being said, I have some questions. My h=
ope isthat there are some here willing to enter into discussion with me.I h=
ave a difficult time with many of the files here. Many times, thereis no qu=
estion included in the file. I can not determine whether ornot the "reply" =
is an intelligent reply. Maybe this has to do withallowable file size.Some =
of the files I have been able to download. (I don't always keepmy email set=
tings on for this group as I get too many - lol) When Ilook at the file I s=
ee problems. There will be complete flat linesilence between the words. Man=
y times the "reply" is also at the samedecibel as the question askers voice=
. Those two things should notoccur naturally considering the devices being =
used. That tells me thatthere is manipulation of the files. Now, what is ma=
nipulation to me,may not be manipulation to others. To me, any altering of =
the recordedfile constitutes manipulation. I do not know if the reply wasin=
telligent or manipulated to be intelligent. Some say that they simply remov=
e the "no response" time. I've beentold it can be as much as 18 seconds rem=
oved from between words. Nowwe run into the problem of us deciding what wor=
d fits in with thequestion. What words are being ignored? Did we take nonse=
nse and makesense? Did we amp every noise/word or only what fit?I think it'=
s great that files are offered for peer review. However, Ithink we have to =
load them untouched or at the very least, offerexactly what was done to the=
 entire file. Time elapsed between words,what was amped, etc. I'd also love=
 to see some of these sessions videotaped with the question asker facing th=
e camera and a second handclock visible. Truly, we aren't researching if we=
 don't have someprotocol in place.Here is an issue I have with the RS Hacks=
. I have the 469. It takesapproximately 18 seconds to scan through the AM f=
requencies. Now, thetypical person would think that we can take that 18 sec=
onds and divideit by the number of AM stations to determine how long we are=
 on eachstation before moving on to the next one. In that way we coulddeter=
mine what is impossible to be said via a radio fragment. However,that's not=
 correct. The scan cycle can vary from one frequency to thenext and of cour=
se the biggest problem is that some stations arepicked up over multiple fre=
quencies; AM 640 can be heard on 630, 640,650, 660 and maybe even 670. That=
 extends the time a great deal. Thisis a difficult problem because it is al=
most impossible for the averageperson to be able to make a determination on=
 time this way. I heard about the following today; An experimenter records =
at the sametime every day Mon-Fri. We hear about the importance of meditati=
ng,automatic writing, etc at the same time every day but what we have torem=
ember with this, is that now we are in essence tuning into the sameradio sh=
ow every day. One of my first experiments with the 469 had mehearing this d=
eep male voice over and over again. What was he tryingto tell me, I wondere=
d. Than I realized that he was speakingapproximately every 18 seconds; ever=
y time the scan hit that station.So, if you are removing up to 18 seconds b=
etween words, then you arereally only recording the words from one station.=
 This post is IN NO WAY trying to start anything besides discussionabout so=
me research problems. I know that there are those who are notconcerned with=
 anything more than the communication itself but I thinkthat it is of the u=
tmost importance to attempt to factor in someprotocol in order for this to =
be considered serious research at all. 

Looking for last minute shopping d=
eals? Find them fast with Yahoo! Search.

easy as instant messaging.=A0You IM, we give.

Once again pal, we are on apposing sid=

As far as Babs having many friends here<BR>
 <BR>
Welllll???<B=
R>
 <BR>
Anyway I want to address the subject of removing time from a =
file.<BR>
The way I am understanding what you mean by removing time is to<B=
R>
cut segments of the recording out of the file.<BR>
 <BR>
I myself d=
o cut out simple noise or static fragments that are naturally occurring in =
the sweep of the box<BR>
for instance the minibox has an inherent hum or th=
ump as it's Creator calls it.<BR>
 <BR>
When I receive a response thro=
ugh the minibox it will go something like this "yes HUM Bruce HUM we HUM ar=
e HUM here HUM"<BR>
I will definitely remove every HUM from between the wor=
ds but that does not change the message or affect the words that are spoken=

I'm assuming that is what you are talking about when you and babs men=

 <BR>
I'm just guessing but maybe babs is tr=
ying to insinuate that researchers here are altering their files., <BR>
If =
so maybe she should be looking for that in her own back yard. There must be=
 someone she knows for a fact that is<BR>
altering communications.<BR>
&nbs=
p;<BR>
And mike please lets not turn this into a whole big thing!<BR>
&nbsp=

Bruce<BR><BR><BR>

e. Many times, there<BR>is no question included in the file. I can not dete=
rmine whether or<BR>not the "reply" is an intelligent reply. Maybe this has=

le to download. (I don't always keep<BR>my email settings on for this group=

will be complete flat line<BR>silence between the words. Many times the "re=
ply" is also at the same<BR>decibel as the question askers voice. Those two=
 things should not<BR>occur naturally considering the devices being used. T=
hat tells me that<BR>there is manipulation of the files. Now, what is manip=
ulation to me,<BR>may not be manipulation to others. To me, any altering of=
 the recorded<BR>file constitutes manipulation. I do not know if the reply =
was<BR>intelligent or manipulated to be intelligent. <BR><BR>Some say that =
they simply remove the "no response" time. I've been<BR>told it can be as m=
uch as 18 seconds removed from between words. Now<BR>we run into the proble=
m of us deciding what word fits in with the<BR>question. What words are bei=
ng ignored? Did we take nonsense and make<BR>sense? Did we amp every noise/=
word or only what fit?<BR><BR>I think it's great that files are offered for=
 peer review. However, I<BR>think we have to load them untouched or at the =
very least, offer<BR>exactly what was done to the entire file. Time elapsed=
 between words,<BR>what was amped, etc. I'd also love to see some of these =
sessions video<BR>taped with the question asker facing the camera and a sec=
ond hand<BR>clock visible. Truly, we aren't researching if we don't have so=
me<BR>protocol in place.<BR><BR>Here is an issue I have with the RS Hacks. =
I have the 469. It takes<BR>approximately 18 seconds to scan through the AM=
 frequencies. Now, the<BR>typical person would think that we can take that =
18 seconds and divide<BR>it by the number of AM stations to determine how l=
ong we are on each<BR>station before moving on to the next one. In that way=
 we could<BR>determine what is impossible to be said via a radio fragment. =
However,<BR>that's not correct. The scan cycle can vary from one frequency =
to the<BR>next and of course the biggest problem is that some stations are<=
BR>picked up over multiple frequencies; AM 640 can be heard on 630, 640,<BR=
>650, 660 and maybe even 670. That extends the time a great deal. This<BR>i=
s a difficult problem because it is almost impossible for the average<BR>pe=
rson to be able to make a determination on time this way. <BR><BR>I heard a=
bout the following today; An experimenter records at the same<BR>time every=
 day Mon-Fri. We hear about the importance of meditating,<BR>automatic writ=
ing, etc at the same time every day but what we have to<BR>remember with th=
is, is that now we are in essence tuning into the same<BR>radio show every =

ale voice over and over again. What was he trying<BR>to tell me, I wondered=
. Than I realized that he was speaking<BR>approximately every 18 seconds; e=
very time the scan hit that station.<BR>So, if you are removing up to 18 se=
